title: How can I protect my joint assets? My husband is an alcoholic who drinks and drives. What about a legal separation?
question: Married 25 years and dont want to lose everthing i have.
answers: A legal separation would require both parties to actually divide their assets and debts so this avenue could help you in getting protection as to his potential negligence. But a legal separation means you are still married to him even though you have divided the assets and debts. Also suggest that any separation agreement contain indemnification clauses. Seek the services of a skilled family law attorney.
The amount of options available to you will depend on how cooperative your husband will be. I suggest that you consult with an experienced attorney on this.
How about a post-nuptial agreement? What about changing title in those joint assets - aka "transmutation" ? What about placing assets in a revocable living trust?
